conversation.content: [exhausted] God, I've been staring at these numbers for what, eighteen hours straight? Twenty? [pause] But this time it's different. [quietly] This isn't just another leveraged buyout or some tech unicorn that'll probably fail anyway. This is— [speeding up] this is actual cancer research, like actual breakthrough stuff that could save thousands of lives. [nervous] The IRR is lower than what the partners usually want, obviously. Way lower. [sigh] But I keep thinking about that presentation from the research team. That little girl they showed, with the, um... with the rare genetic condition. [emotional] She's eight. Same age as my niece. [pause] And they said with proper funding, they could have treatment ready in two years. Two years! [animated] I've structured deals that made partners millions just so some hedge fund guy could buy another yacht. [bitter] Literally, a yacht. [long pause] But this? This could actually matter. [anxious] I mean, I still need to sell it to the investment committee tomorrow. They're gonna look at the projections and probably laugh me out of the room. [determined] But I built in the social impact metrics, the government grant possibilities, the— [excited] wait, actually, if we position this right, the PR value alone could be worth millions. [relieved] Maybe I can make this work after all. [warm] Maybe for once, the money can actually do something good.

subject: The private equity analyst deal you structured funding breakthrough medical research
